entry.title: Why Tether Is Launching a P2P Video Chat App Called Keet
entry.summary: The world’s largest stablecoin issuer launched the app along with sister company Bitfinex.

entry.title: Elon Musk’s Tesla Still Holds $222M in Digital Assets After Dumping $936M in Bitcoin
entry.summary: After startling markets last week by announcing it sold 75% of its Bitcoin, Tesla revealed today it still has $222 million of "digital assets" on the books.

entry.title: Mark Cuban: SEC Regulating Crypto Will Be a ‘Nightmare’
entry.summary: After Pat Toomey criticized the SEC, Cuban added: “Think this is bad? Wait till you see what they come up with for registration of tokens.”

entry.title: Chipotle’s ‘Buy the Dip’ Promo Includes $200K in Crypto for Customers’ Coinbase Accounts
entry.summary: The restaurant chain is also giving away $2 million in guacamole and queso to celebrate National Avocado Day.

entry.title: 'Audits Are Not Bulletproof': How Audius Was Hacked for $6M in Ethereum Tokens
entry.summary: A long-overlooked vulnerability led an attacker to steal nearly 18.6 million AUDIO tokens from the Web3 streaming music service.

entry.title: The 10 Public Companies With the Biggest Bitcoin Portfolios
entry.summary: Firms including MicroStrategy, Tesla and Coinbase have purchased billions of dollars worth of Bitcoin between them.

entry.title: Crypto Market Dips Ahead of Upcoming Fed Meeting
entry.summary: The crypto market flipped red as investors prepare for a two-day Fed meeting which is expected to see a 75-basis-point rate hike.

entry.title: Bankrupt Voyager Digital Calls FTX's Bailout a 'Low-Ball Bid'
entry.summary: Bankrupt crypto brokerage Voyager Digital has called a rescue deal proposed by FTX “a low-ball bid dressed up as a white knight rescue.”

entry.title: Barclays Joins List of Investors Backing Crypto Custodian Copper: Report
entry.summary: UK-based multinational private bank Barclays is expected to invest a sum "in the millions of dollars" in crypto custody firm Copper.

entry.title: Yuga Labs Threatened With Possible Class-Action Lawsuit
entry.summary: The suit likely will allege that Yuga Labs’ Bored Ape Yacht Club NFTs and ApeCoin are securities that failed to deliver on promised returns.

entry.title: Zipmex Says Discussions With Potential Investors ‘Have Progressed Significantly’
entry.summary: The company, which paused customer withdrawals only a few days ago, may have found a potential buyer.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Michael Saylor Goads Elon Musk for Tesla’s Bitcoin Dump
entry.summary: Elsewhere, Minecraft said it will prohibit NFT use on its servers in addition to banning NFTs that use the game’s assets.

entry.title: Inside the Crypto-Bot Ghost Towns of Telegram
entry.summary: Amid the downturn, many of Telegram’s crypto groups have become bots shilling to other bots.

entry.title: Unpacking Uniswap’s ‘Fee Switch’
entry.summary: A governance vote could give UNI token holders a slice of the exchange’s transaction fees. So what’s stopping them?

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Ethereum Outpaces Bitcoin as Markets Thaw
entry.summary: Seven-day price action remained mostly positive even as industry news ... did not.

entry.title: Should Victims of NFT Hacks Be Compensated by Creators?
entry.summary: Amid rising attacks, the debate is growing.

entry.title: Animoca Brands Launches DAO to Develop Metaverse Standards
entry.summary: Several prominent Web3 names have joined the effort to ensure interoperability among virtual worlds.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried’s FTX May Buy South Korean Crypto Exchange Bithumb: Report
entry.summary: The emergent white-knight firm of the 2022 crypto winter appears to be exploring more acquisition options.

entry.title: Bitcoin Traders in Argentina Restricted From Buying Dollars
entry.summary: It’s an attempt by the central bank to stop the flight of capital and tame inflation.

entry.title: BlockFi Had $600 Million in Crypto Loans Not Covered by Collateral in Q2
entry.summary: The company loaned out $1.8 billion and held only $1.2 billion in collateral, according to BlockFi's own numbers.

entry.title: Who’s Firing—And Still Hiring—During the Bitcoin Bear Market
entry.summary: Some crypto companies are feeling the crunch of a market crash and reducing their employee headcount to cope—but others are still expanding and securing fresh talent. Here's who's hiring and firing in crypto right now.

entry.title: California Ends Ban on Bitcoin and Other Crypto Donations to Political Campaigns
entry.summary: In sunny California, crypto’s getting into politics.

entry.title: ​​Twitter Cancels Q2 Earnings Call, Citing Elon Musk's 'Pending Acquisition'
entry.summary: The social media giant has canceled this month’s quarterly earnings call, citing ongoing litigation against billionaire Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

entry.title: Three Arrows Capital Founders Cite 3 Key Crypto Trades That Blew Up the Firm
entry.summary: In a lengthy post-mortem, Three Arrow Capital’s founders say Terra, staked Ethereum, and Grayscale’s Bitcoin Trust contributed to the firm's collapse.

entry.title: Ethereum Held on Exchanges Plunges as Stakers Prepare for The Merge
entry.summary: Ethereum on exchanges hit a four-year low alongside steady inflows into the network’s staking contract ahead of The Merge.

entry.title: South Korean Authorities Widen Terra Probe as Co-Founder Daniel Shin's Home Raided
entry.summary: Prosecutors raided the Seoul home of Terraform Labs co-founder Daniel Shin as part of an investigation into the collapse of Terra's UST.

entry.title: DeFi Token Behind Curve Finance Jumps 21% Amid Stablecoin News
entry.summary: DeFi giant Curve Finance is joining Aave in taking aim at Maker’s decentralized stablecoin with a new, over-collateralized product.

entry.title: LinkedIn Founder Reid Hoffman Turns DALL-E AI Art Into Solana NFTs
entry.summary: Hoffman is using OpenAI’s AI-powered image rendering platform to generate NFT artwork to auction via Magic Eden.

entry.title: OpenSea Debuts Solana NFT Launchpad to Lackluster Demand
entry.summary: OpenSea now has its own minting platform to rival Magic Eden, but launch partner Zoonies appears to be stumbling out the gate.

entry.title: Ethereum Merge? Get Ready for the 'Surge, Verge, Purge, and Splurge', Says Vitalik Buterin
entry.summary: After the Ethereum merge, there will be many more upgrades to the network: the surge, the verge, the purge, and a splurge. Fun!

entry.title: Mike Novogratz on Crypto Riches: 'It's Not Normal to Make 200 Times Your Money on Things'
entry.summary: The billionaire cryptocurrency investor warns that not everyone can be a billionaire cryptocurrency investor.

entry.title: SEC Claims Coinbase Currently Lists Nine Crypto Assets That Are Securities
entry.summary: The SEC revealed which assets on Coinbase it considers unregistered securities in a complaint against a former Coinbase employee who is accused of insider trading.

entry.title: Epic Games 'Definitely Won’t' Follow Minecraft’s Lead and Ban NFTs, Says CEO
entry.summary: "Stores and operating system makers shouldn’t interfere by forcing their views onto others," says CEO and co-founder Tim Sweeney.

entry.title: NFTs and Crypto Key to an Open Metaverse: Former Amazon Exec Matthew Ball
entry.summary: The venture capitalist asserts that gamers don’t like NFTs because game publishers have so far taken the wrong approach.

entry.title: Michael Saylor Takes Shot at Elon Musk on Twitter Over Tesla’s $936M Bitcoin Sale
entry.summary: The MicroStrategy CEO fired off a series of tweets seemingly aimed at Elon Musk, after his EV firm Tesla sold 75% of its Bitcoin holdings.

entry.title: DOJ, SEC Charge Former Coinbase Product Manager With Insider Trading
entry.summary: Former Coinbase product manager Ishan Wahi and two others made more than $1 million trading on inside information, authorities allege.

entry.title: Crypto Exchange Blockchain.com is Reducing Its Workforce by 25%
entry.summary: Blockchain.com is the latest exchange to announce mass layoffs. The restructuring will shutter operations in Argentina and halt expansion.

entry.title: Bitcoin Slips Below $23,000 As Eurozone Moves to Curb Inflation with Interest Rate Hike
entry.summary: After a recent mini bull run that saw Bitcoin touch the $24,000 mark, the leading cryptocurrency is once again trading below $23,000.

entry.title: Finnish Customs Sells Off $47 Million in Seized Bitcoin, Will Donate Proceeds to Ukraine
entry.summary: Had they timed the market right, Finnish authorities could have made more than double the amount.

entry.title: Embattled Crypto Lender Vauld Owes Over $400 Million to Creditors: Report
entry.summary: Crypto firm Vauld reportedly owes more than $400 million to its creditors, with 90% of that amount deposited by individual retail investors.

entry.title: Matthew Ball on the Role of Crypto and NFTs in the Metaverse
entry.summary: The former Amazon Studios exec and venture capitalist spoke with Decrypt’s Kate Irwin about how crypto fits into the metaverse at an event in Beverly Hills, California.

entry.title: gm: Binance CEO CZ Talks Bailouts, Regulator Demands, and Simulation Theory
entry.summary: In an extensive conversation with Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott, Binance CEO CZ talks global and US regulation, Binance HQ locations, crypto bailouts and how he approaches deals, the sports marketing push by big crypto exchanges and why Binance went slower, and why he believes we live in a simulation.

entry.title: Chelsea Manning Talks Crypto, Privacy, and Security
entry.summary: Chelsea Manning, who gave classified documents regarding the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq to WikiLeaks in 2010, talked to Decrypt's Stacy Elliott about crypto and privacy, decentralization and government, and her work with Nym.

entry.title: Binance CEO CZ on Crypto Bailouts and the Deals He Would Not Do
entry.summary: In an interview for Decrypt's gm podcast, CZ laid out Binance's approach to "bailouts" amid the crypto liquidity crunch, and criticized Alameda's complicated lifeline to Voyager.

entry.title: gm: Senator Cynthia Lummis Is Fighting for Bitcoin
entry.summary: Wyoming Sen. Cynthia Lummis, the "Bitcoin Senator," joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott on the gm podcast to talk about the Lummis-Gillibrand crypto regulation bill, the need for clearer policy on crypto in DC, and converting crypto skeptics—plus her take on the bear market and NFTs. Make sure to subscribe to the podcast.

entry.title: #DecryptLive Covering The Continued Crypto Crash
entry.summary: Decrypt’s Dan Roberts, Kate Irwin, Stacy Elliott and Jason Nelson discuss the news and parse through what’s happened and what might happen next.

entry.title: Lolli Bitcoin Shopping App CEO at NFT NYC: NFTs 'Captured the Zeitgeist'
entry.summary: Alex Adelman, CEO of Bitcoin shopping rewards app Lolli, talked to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward at NFT NYC about why NFTs have impressed him and why he's "kind of sad" because Bitcoin "should have captured" the cultural moment that Ethereum and NFTs did.

entry.title: NFT NYC: How Dequency Is Using Blockchain to Decentralize Music Usage Rights
entry.summary: Just ahead of a live event during NFT NYC from BeetsDAO and Decrypt, Margaret Link and Keatly Haldeman of Dequency talk to Decrypt EIC Dan Roberts about how their company is using the Algorand blockchain to de-bug the decades-old process of music synchronization rights.
